title: (x) OneFour striped sans Letraset font - Prisma {Stephen}
content:
This font reminds me of an old Letraset font but I do not remember the name (and my Letraset specimen is at home...)  
Can anybody help me?

Cheers.

Ramiro.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [30397\_regular.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150321005220/http:/typophile.com/files/30397_regular.jpg) | 36.79 KB |
author: Ramiro Espinoza

comments.content:
This isn't an old Letraset font, it is even older ;-)  
This is Prisma, from Rudolf Koch / Gebr. Klingspor. Prisma is an inline, all-caps version of Kabel. There isn't an official digital version, but there are free fonts around the internet somewhere.

James Goggin and [Lineto](http://web.archive.org/web/20150321005220/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Lineto) will release Prisma in various styles later this year. In the meantime, if you don't mind going '70s, there's Rian Hughes' [Dazzle](http://web.archive.org/web/20150321005220/http:/www.veer.com/partner/link.aspx?i=1048&c=4&p=products/typedetail.aspx?image=DET0000260).

Or, if you'd prefer the 70s Bauhaus version, this one should be going live at myfonts.com next week...

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150321005220im_/http:/typophile.com/files/boho-a-gogo-nf_4038.gif)
